net.semanticmetadata.lire.indexing.tools

Class ParallelExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.semanticmetadata.lire.indexing.tools.ParallelExtractor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ParallelExtractor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Extractor is a configurable class that extracts multiple features from multiple images and puts them into a data file. Main purpose is run multiple extractors at multiple machines and put the data files into one single index. Images are references relatively to the data file, so it should work fine for network file systems.

    File format is specified as: (12(345)+('-1'))+ with 1-5 being ...

    1. Length of the file name [4 bytes], an int n giving the number of bytes for the file name 2. File name, relative to the outfile [n bytes, see above] 3. Feature index [1 byte], see static members 4. Feature value length [4 bytes], an int k giving the number of bytes encoding the value 5. Feature value [k bytes, see above]

    The file is sent through an GZIPOutputStream, so it's compressed in addition.

    Note that the outfile has to be in a folder parent to all images! // TODO: Change to LinkedBlockingQueue and Files.readAllBytes.

    Author:
    Mathias Lux, mathias@juggle.at, 08.03.13
